project.name: prefix

longdescription.p: An effort to bring Gentoo Portage to users not on a Gentoo Linux operating system, by means of installing in a "prefix".

Usually, Gentoo's Portage installs in the root of the filesystem hierarchy, '/'. On systems other than Gentoo Linux, this usually results in problems, due to conflicts of software packages. Instead, Gentoo Prefix Portage installs with an offset, allowing to install in another location in the filesystem hierarchy, hence avoiding conflicts. Next to this offset, Gentoo Prefix Portage runs unprivileged, meaning no root user or rights are required to use it.

Using an offset, a "prefix", it is possible for many "alternative" user groups to from a large part of the plethora of packages in the Gentoo Portage tree. Currently, Mac OS X users on PPC and x86 platforms, Fedora Core 4 users on x86_64, and preliminary Solaris and Windows cases are running on prefixed portage software.
